page.title: 14STUDLEY,WARWICKSHIRE (cont.)
page.content: Studley is bounded by the A435 and the A448 and on the map looks rather like an upturned capital A.It is a thriving place but there does not appear to be any focal point,any undisputed village centre.There is not enough industry in the village to cater for all of the inhabitants and about 50% of the working population have to commute to mainly Redditch or Birmingham to find jobs.Studley used to be a main centre of the needle making industry and although needles are still made here,the importance of this to the village is diminishing.Nowadays the prominent feature is the modern,indeed futuristic Co-op supermarket.The building has won design awards but is regarded as a monstrosity by many of the local inhabitants.
